hook.text: You grab your phone every morning before opening your eyes. You never decided to. The habit decided for you.

buildup.text: Charles Duhigg identified the habit loop: cue, routine, reward. Every habit follows this pattern.

discovery.text: The cue triggers the behavior. The routine is the action. The reward tells the brain to repeat it.

twist.text: You can't delete a habit. But you can rewire it by keeping the cue and reward, changing only the routine.

climax.text: Understanding the loop gives you leverage. Identify the cue, swap the routine, keep the reward intact.

punchline.text: Every habit has a loop. Find it and rewire it.

quiz.question: What are the three parts of the habit loop?
